remarks: Define the class of all undirected simple hypergraphs.  An undirected simple hypergraph is a special (non-simple, multiple, multi-) hypergraph ` <. V , E >. ` where ` E ` is an injective (one-to-one) function into subsets of ` V ` , representing the (one or more) vertices incident to the edge.  This definition corresponds to definition of hypergraphs in section I.1 of [Bollobas] p. 7 (except that the empty set seems to be allowed to be an "edge") or section 1.10 of [Diestel] p. 27, where "E is a subsets of [[...] the power set of V, that is the set of all subsets of V" resp.  "the elements of E a (non-empty) subsets (of any cardinality) of V".  (Contributed by AV, 19-Jan-2020.)
